com.snakybo.torch.graphics.texture

Class Texture

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.snakybo.torch.asset.Asset
      • com.snakybo.torch.graphics.texture.Texture

  • public final class Texture
extends Asset

    You can create new Texture, or create a Texture from an image.

    Since:
    1.0

    • Constructor Detail

      • Texture

        public Texture(int type,
               int width,
               int height)

        Create a new texture with the specified width and height.

        Parameters:
        type - The OpenGL type (e.g. GL_TEXTURE_2D, or GL_TEXTURE_3D).
        width - The desired width.
        height - The desired height.

      • Texture

        public Texture(int type,
               int width,
               int height,
               int filters)

        Create a new texture with the specified width and height.

        Valid values for the filters parameter are:

        • GL_LINEAR
        • GL_NEAREST
        • GL_LINEAR_MIPMAP_LINEAR
        • GL_LINEAR_MIPMAP_NEAREST
        • GL_NEAREST_MIPMAP_LINEAR
        • GL_NEAREST_MIPMAP_NEAREST
        Parameters:
        type - The OpenGL type (e.g. GL_TEXTURE_2D, or GL_TEXTURE_3D).
        width - The desired width.
        height - The desired height.
        filters - The OpenGL filters (see JavaDoc for info).

      • Texture

        public Texture(int type,
               int width,
               int height,
               int filters,
               float anisoLevel)

        Create a new texture with the specified width and height.

        Valid values for the filters parameter are:

        • GL_LINEAR
        • GL_NEAREST
        • GL_LINEAR_MIPMAP_LINEAR
        • GL_LINEAR_MIPMAP_NEAREST
        • GL_NEAREST_MIPMAP_LINEAR
        • GL_NEAREST_MIPMAP_NEAREST

        Note: Anisotropic filtering (anisoLevel) is only used if filters is set to one of the mipmap-enabled filters.

        Parameters:
        type - The OpenGL type (e.g. GL_TEXTURE_2D, or GL_TEXTURE_3D).
        width - The desired width.
        height - The desired height.
        filters - The OpenGL filters (see JavaDoc for info).
        anisoLevel - The desired anisotropic filtering level. If automatically clamped to the highest value the system supports.

      • Texture

        public Texture(int type,
               int width,
               int height,
               int filters,
               float anisoLevel,
               int internalFormat)

        Create a new texture with the specified width and height.

        Valid values for the filters parameter are:

        • GL_LINEAR
        • GL_NEAREST
        • GL_LINEAR_MIPMAP_LINEAR
        • GL_LINEAR_MIPMAP_NEAREST
        • GL_NEAREST_MIPMAP_LINEAR
        • GL_NEAREST_MIPMAP_NEAREST

        Note: Anisotropic filtering (anisoLevel) is only used if filters is set to one of the mipmap-enabled filters.

        Parameters:
        type - The OpenGL type (e.g. GL_TEXTURE_2D, or GL_TEXTURE_3D).
        width - The desired width.
        height - The desired height.
        filters - The OpenGL filters (see JavaDoc for info).
        anisoLevel - The desired anisotropic filtering level. If automatically clamped to the highest value the system supports.
        internalFormat - The internal format of the texture, usually GL_RGBA.

      • Texture

        public Texture(int type,
               int width,
               int height,
               int filters,
               float anisoLevel,
               int internalFormat,
               int format)

        Create a new texture with the specified width and height.

        Valid values for the filters parameter are:

        • GL_LINEAR
        • GL_NEAREST
        • GL_LINEAR_MIPMAP_LINEAR
        • GL_LINEAR_MIPMAP_NEAREST
        • GL_NEAREST_MIPMAP_LINEAR
        • GL_NEAREST_MIPMAP_NEAREST

        Note: Anisotropic filtering (anisoLevel) is only used if filters is set to one of the mipmap-enabled filters.

        Parameters:
        type - The OpenGL type (e.g. GL_TEXTURE_2D, or GL_TEXTURE_3D).
        width - The desired width.
        height - The desired height.
        filters - The OpenGL filters (see JavaDoc for info).
        anisoLevel - The desired anisotropic filtering level. If automatically clamped to the highest value the system supports.
        internalFormat - The internal format of the texture, usually GL_RGBA.
        format - The format of the texture, usually the same as internalFormat.

      • Texture

        public Texture(int type,
               int width,
               int height,
               int filters,
               float anisoLevel,
               int internalFormat,
               int format,
               boolean clamp)

        Create a new texture with the specified width and height.

        Valid values for the filters parameter are:

        • GL_LINEAR
        • GL_NEAREST
        • GL_LINEAR_MIPMAP_LINEAR
        • GL_LINEAR_MIPMAP_NEAREST
        • GL_NEAREST_MIPMAP_LINEAR
        • GL_NEAREST_MIPMAP_NEAREST

        Note: Anisotropic filtering (anisoLevel) is only used if filters is set to one of the mipmap-enabled filters.

        Parameters:
        type - The OpenGL type (e.g. GL_TEXTURE_2D, or GL_TEXTURE_3D).
        width - The desired width.
        height - The desired height.
        filters - The OpenGL filters (see JavaDoc for info).
        anisoLevel - The desired anisotropic filtering level. If automatically clamped to the highest value the system supports.
        internalFormat - The internal format of the texture, usually GL_RGBA.
        format - The format of the texture, usually the same as internalFormat.
        clamp - If clamp is set to true, the texture will clamp, if it's set to false, the texture will repeat instead.

      • Texture

        public Texture(java.awt.image.BufferedImage bufferedImage,
               int type)

        Create a texture from the given image.

        Parameters:
        bufferedImage - The image to create a texture from.
        type - The OpenGL type (e.g. GL_TEXTURE_2D, or GL_TEXTURE_3D).

        filters - The OpenGL filters (see JavaDoc for info).

        Valid values for the filters parameter are:

        • GL_NEAREST

        • GL_LINEAR_MIPMAP_NEAREST

        • GL_NEAREST_MIPMAP_NEAREST

        Note: Anisotropic filtering (anisoLevel) is only used if filters is set to one of the mipmap-enabled filters.

      • Texture

        public Texture(java.awt.image.BufferedImage bufferedImage,
               int type,
               int filters,
               float anisoLevel,
               int internalFormat,
               int format)

        Create a texture from the given image.

        Valid values for the filters parameter are:

        • GL_LINEAR
        • GL_NEAREST
        • GL_LINEAR_MIPMAP_LINEAR
        • GL_LINEAR_MIPMAP_NEAREST
        • GL_NEAREST_MIPMAP_LINEAR
        • GL_NEAREST_MIPMAP_NEAREST

        Note: Anisotropic filtering (anisoLevel) is only used if filters is set to one of the mipmap-enabled filters.

        Parameters:
        bufferedImage - The image to create a texture from.
        type - The OpenGL type (e.g. GL_TEXTURE_2D, or GL_TEXTURE_3D).
        filters - The OpenGL filters (see JavaDoc for info).
        anisoLevel - The desired anisotropic filtering level. If automatically clamped to the highest value the system supports.
        internalFormat - The internal format of the texture, usually GL_RGBA.
        format - The format of the texture, usually the same as internalFormat.

      • Texture

        public Texture(java.awt.image.BufferedImage bufferedImage,
               int type,
               int filters,
               float anisoLevel,
               int internalFormat,
               int format,
               boolean clamp)

        Create a texture from the given image.

        Valid values for the filters parameter are:

        • GL_LINEAR
        • GL_NEAREST
        • GL_LINEAR_MIPMAP_LINEAR
        • GL_LINEAR_MIPMAP_NEAREST
        • GL_NEAREST_MIPMAP_LINEAR
        • GL_NEAREST_MIPMAP_NEAREST

        Note: Anisotropic filtering (anisoLevel) is only used if filters is set to one of the mipmap-enabled filters.

        Parameters:
        bufferedImage - The image to create a texture from.
        type - The OpenGL type (e.g. GL_TEXTURE_2D, or GL_TEXTURE_3D).
        filters - The OpenGL filters (see JavaDoc for info).
        anisoLevel - The desired anisotropic filtering level. If automatically clamped to the highest value the system supports.
        internalFormat - The internal format of the texture, usually GL_RGBA.
        format - The format of the texture, usually the same as internalFormat.
        clamp - If clamp is set to true, the texture will clamp, if it's set to false, the texture will repeat instead.
